page.title: 12Shiskine/B'waterfoot c 1945
page.content: Buses were the main form of transport. The three family bus companies were Robertsons, Curries & Bannatynes. Only important people like the doctor & minister had cars. Lorries delivered visitors' luggage to the place they were going to stay - local boys getting a penny to unload. People didn't come on holiday in cars because there weren't any car ferries. Horses were still used to do work on the farms as well as tractors. Shops have changed a lot. There was a shop at Shedog that sold anything you needed. Part of the Kinloch Hotel in Blackwaterfoot was a shop & post office. What was the grocer's shop, is now a hairdresser & a sports shop. The present day grocer's shop was then a branch of the Bank of Scotland. Children stayed at the two-teacher Shiskine School till they were 14 yrs.
